intro: Euryops dasyphyllus, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and dense, foliage. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while the flowers are bright yellow and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryops dasyphyllus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
